definition: to kick a ball around/(fig.) to mutually shirk responsibility/to pass the buck

sentences.english: The ball screwed and flew into the goal.
sentences.chinese: 皮球旋转着飞进了球门。

sentences.english: Ah ah ah, fruit trees on the long ball.
sentences.chinese: 啊呀呀，果树上长皮球了。

sentences.english: The ball drifted on the water.
You will soon understand that work is a rubber ball. If you drop it, it will bounce back.
sentences.chinese: 你很快会发现工作是个橡皮球，掉下去又会弹起来。

sentences.english: I wanted to head the ball and I ended up touching it with my hand.
sentences.chinese: 我本想头球，但最后皮球碰到了我的手上。

sentences.english: Of my final re-transformation from India-rubber back to flesh?
sentences.chinese: 希望我最终从印度皮球再次转变为血肉之躯吗？

sentences.english: Throw a ball at someone's head for fun in New York.
sentences.chinese: 在纽约，不可以把皮球扔到路人的脑袋上取乐。

sentences.english: The ball bounces next to the barbecue.
sentences.chinese: 皮球跳到了烧烤架旁边。

sentences.english: You will soon understand that work is a rubber ball.
sentences.chinese: 你马上就发现惟有工作是一个橡皮球。

sentences.english: He ran square from the left before flicking the ball through at a right angle.
sentences.chinese: 他从左路内切，然后轻弹皮球精准地挑射入网。

sentences.english: What you need to do is kick a ball into each of the three green balloons.
sentences.chinese: 你需要做的是踢皮球到三个绿色的气球。

sentences.english: Health care should not become a political football.
sentences.chinese: 保健问题不应该成为被踢来踢去的政治皮球。

sentences.english: The 9th minute, Totty long-range returns the favor, what a pity rubber ball altitude range.
sentences.chinese: 第9分钟，托蒂远射还以颜色，可惜皮球射高。

sentences.english: The ball bounces between two big trees.
sentences.chinese: 皮球在两棵大树之间跳跃。

sentences.english: What I wanted to talk to you about was the ball.
sentences.chinese: 其实我是想和你谈一谈有关于皮球的事情。

sentences.english: As a child, he used to enjoy bouncing rubber balls from one wall to another.
sentences.chinese: 小时候，他总喜欢让皮球从一堵墙反弹到另一堵墙。

definition: to knock on the door/to take a shot on goal (sports)
(soccer, handball etc) to kick or shoot the ball towards the goal
corner kick (in soccer)/free strike in hockey
to receive a served ball (volleyball, tennis etc)/to catch a ball thrown by sb
an overhung door/a door that hinges upwards
ten-pin bowling/bowling ball/(baseball etc) ground ball
